title: 數學題3 Prove limit x->∞ (1+k/x)^x = e^k

replies.msg:
limit x->∞ (1+k/x)^x
(since y = e^(ln y))
=limit x->∞ e^( ln (1+k/x)^x )
=limit x->∞ e^( x ln (1+k/x) )
=e^ ( limit x->∞ ( x ln (1+k/x) ) )

Focus on limit x->∞ ( x ln (1+k/x) )
limit x->∞ ( x ln (1+k/x) )
= limit x->∞ ( (1/ (1/x)) ln (1+k/x) )
= limit x->∞ ( ( ln (1+k/x) ) / (1/x) )
(0/0 case, apply L'hospital rule)

d/dx ( ln(1+k/x) )
=( 1 /(1+k/x) ) * (1+k/x)'
= ( 1 / ( (x + k)/x ) ) * (-k/x^2)
= (xk / (x+k) ) (-1/x^2)

d/dx ( 1/x) ) = -1/x^2

limit x->∞ ( ( ln (1+k/x) ) / (1/x) )
=limit x->∞ ( (xk / (x+k) ) (-1/x^2) / (-1/x^2) )
=limit x->∞ ( (xk / (x+k) )
(∞/∞ case, apply L'hospital rule)

d/dx (xk) = k
d/dx (x+k) = 1

limit x->∞ ( (xk / (x+k) )
= limit x->∞ (k / 1 )
= k

So, limit x->∞ ( x ln (1+k/x) = k
e^ ( limit x->∞ ( x ln (1+k/x) ) ) = e^k
limit x->∞ (1+k/x)^x =e^k

If k = 1
limit x->∞ (1+1/x)^x =e^1 = e

If k = -1
limit x->∞ (1-1/x)^x =e^(-1) = 1/e

limit y->∞ (y/(y-3))^y
= limit y->∞ ((y-3)/y)^(-y)
= limit y->∞ ( 1/ ( (y-3)/y) )^y )
= limit y->∞ ( 1/ ( 1- (3/y) ) )^y )

(Since limit x->∞ (1+k/x)^x =e^k
limit y->∞ ( ( 1- (3/y) ) )^y ) = e^-3

= limit y->∞ ( 1/ (e^(-3))
= e^3

So, limit y->∞ (y/(y-3))^y = e^3
